intro: Oligomeris upingtoniae, commonly known as the Upington's oligomeris, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, with a central disc of tubular florets. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
